items.sentence: I don't know whether I could get used to that.
I'm heating up some soup on the stove for you.
We don't have time for breakfast this morning.
How much time does it take you to walk a mile?
How many books have you read so far this year?
You should at least pretend that you're happy.
How many years have you been living in Boston?
This bag of yours isn't in the best condition.
Who told you that Tom had been in an accident?
Tom thought something bad was about to happen.
Tom made it very clear that we should do that.
Tomorrow's Tom and Mary's wedding anniversary.
I wonder how many times we'll have to do that.
Could you lend me your bicycle this afternoon?
Just a moment please. I'll be back in a jiffy.
There's no way Tom can verify the information.
Tom was 16 going on 17 when he first met Mary.
Tom had never seen the man before in his life.
Tom had to sell his car to help pay his debts.
Tom was suddenly overcome with a deep despair.
